medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 6 months of age with the presence of pubic hair and enlargement of the penis. At age 2 years, the patient had frequent erections and hyperactivity. By age 3 years, he exhibited increasing pigmentation and was admitted with upper respiratory infection, lethargy, vomiting, and abdominal pain. Hormonal levels registered elevated testosterone levels and low cortisol.
medical_history.past_medical_history: X-linked adrenal hypoplasia congenita due to a novel mutation in the DAX1 gene.
medical_history.family_history: The patient had an older brother who died from pneumonia at age 7 years, presenting hyperpigmentation without signs of sexual precocity.
